commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: ...The School Idol Festival?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Yeah, we'd like to hold the School Idol Festival at Nijigasaki.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: It'll also help to promote the school. If the event's a success, I'm sure we'll see a surge in new applicants!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: You should also join us all on stage as a school idol!

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Me?

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Yup! It'd be such a shame for you to waste those beautiful dancing skills of yours!

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: Once you experience the exhilaration of performing on stage, you will never forget it.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: It's not very often you can show off everything you have and bring excitement to those around you with it, right?

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: We would like Nijigasaki to be the place where everyone involved can shout out their love!

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: There were even a lot of kids who came to the school tour yesterday that said they love school idols.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: That's right, Shioriko. A lot of people not only knew about Î¼'s and Aqours, but us as well.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: There are so many people who are actually watching and following us closely.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: We want to hold the festival also as a means to give back to these people.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Since we'll work extra hard, is it okay to assume you will give us permission to use the school?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: No, it is not okay.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: What? Is it because you do not want to go on stage?

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: You're such a shy little Shioko! I'll teach you everything from the basics if you're really that worried!

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: No, I am against the idea of our school acting as the event venue.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: What?!

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Why? Why?! Don't be so mean!

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: It is not my intention to be mean. I am just saying that I cannot approve that which cannot be approved.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: But haven't you accepted and recognized us?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I have a certain degree of recognition for your zeal towards being school idols and your genuine efforts. However, this is a completely separate issue.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: What exactly do you mean?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: The School Idol Festival is different from a regular live show or event, correct?

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Well that's obvious. It's a festival of school idols.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: The type where we get messages from school idols across the country who want to join in.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: An event of such scale to gather that many school idols would mean there would also be quite a lot of visitors.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: We're not sure how many people will come, but that's what we're hoping for.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: A whole bunch of people will come. For sure!

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: I'm sure there'll be a lot of fans of just Î¼'s and Aqours alone.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: So it seems. As such, I cannot give you my approval.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Um, could you tell us why?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Simply because the school does not belong to you alone.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I assume this event will span over a weekend, however, there are also many clubs who use the school on these days as well. Some may also have upcoming matches or tournaments.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: However, you would need to utilize the entire school in order to hold an event of that scale.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: In other words, the students of other clubs will be robbed of their places of practice.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Are you calling for a cancellation of all other club activities on that day? Do you have the right to take away that precious time from them?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: W-Well...

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Furthermore, my reasons for rejection do not stop there. I do not think you are able to manage an event of such a scale as that of the School Idol Festival.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Do you understand that responsibility comes part and parcel with running an event? You cannot simply assume that it is just about singing and dancing.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I believe you will all give wonderful performances on stage. However, are you not taking the responsibilities of running the event a little too lightly?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: It's not our intention to take it lightly...

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: While I understand how passionate you all are, I cannot give you my approval on behalf of the student council. This is final.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: ARGH! That Shioko! I thought she finally became one of our allies, but she's still our enemy! Traitor!

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: I totally thought she'd approve!

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: However, there is solid reasoning behind what Shioriko says. As the student council president, she cannot give her approval so lightly.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Still! She's leaving us so high and dry!

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: Yeah, it would've been nice for her to help us think of a way to pull the event off.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: Are we gonna quit? Rina-chan Board says, "Droop."

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: But I definitely think using the school as our event venue is a really good idea!

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: I agree with Ayumu. Let us think of a way to convince Shioriko!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Shioriko's reasons for rejecting our suggestion were because we'd disrupt the other students and she has doubts about our ability to manage the event, right?

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: In other words, if we are able to address those issues, then...

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Right! It's gonna be tough, but let's all put our thinking caps on!
